column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The acting head of the Tripoli-based Civil Registry Authority (CRA) was killed in Tripoli and a colleague wounded. Three armed individuals ''wearing army fatigue'' and in a ''military vehicle'' attacked the CRA headquarters in Drebi firing at all the offices ''in a random manner''.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Oct 11th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 9 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Forces loyal to Libyas United Nations-brokered government (Operation Solid Structure) advanced on the remaining pockets of Islamic State group fighters holding out in the coastal city of Sirte on 11 October. No actual fighting reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The managing director of the Bank of North Africa in Fezzan was kidnapped on 11 October. He disappeared while on his way home from Sebha to Al-Buwanis, close to the Tamenhint airbase. His car was apparently found riddled with bullet holes.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: An ISIS-cell was chased away from a rental house in Souq al-Nemlah in Sabha, a cell member being a Saudi national was reportedly shot in the leg following a shootout with youth from the Qadhadhfa/(Gaddafi) tribe. Photos show weapons, military clothing and other objects left behind by the cell.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The pregnant wife of one of the leading Salafists in Khoms died on 12 October when gunmen tried to kill her husband. The attackers are unknown. Although there have been some clashes between rival families in Khoms it is suspected they may be Islamic State (IS) sympathisers.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Staff at Benghazi's Jalaa and Kuwaifiya respiratory diseases hospitals demonstrated today against the decision last week of Beida-based prime minister Abdulah Al-Thinni to sack Reida El-Oakley as his health minister.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Staff at Benghazi's Jalaa and Kuwaifiya respiratory diseases hospitals demonstrated today against the decision last week of Beida-based prime minister Abdulah Al-Thinni to sack Reida El-Oakley as his health minister.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Tawerghans based in the refugee camp in Tripoli's Falah district protested against the UN-brokered peacedeal signed on 31 August in Tunis between Tawergha local council and Misrata municipal council.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: On October 12 ISIS's Amaq reported that 3 technicals of Bonyan al-Marsous, Operation Solid Structure forces were destroyed in multiple IED blasts on the Coastal Road between Sirte and Misrata.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Members of staff at the Bank of North Africa branches in Fezzan and of Al-Buwanis district near Sebha have protested on 12 October at the kidnapping of the bank's southern managing director.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Oct 13th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 8 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Oct 14th, intensive fighting in Sirte's Manara district, one of the last parts of the town still not captured from the so-called Islamic State, has left 14 soldiers belonging to the Bunyan Marsous Operations Room dead and another 35 wounded. 24 US air strikes hit IS positions.

column6: Government of Libya (2014-) General National Congress
column17: A handful of members of the former General National Council and the former Tripoli 'prime minister' staged an apparent coup in Tripoli, taking over the the GNC's old premises next to Tripoli's Rixos Hotel and declaring themselves in power again. The takeover followed a stand-off in the area since early morning between gunmen supporting the former GNC and those linked to Sewehli. The militias took control over the State Council Assembly and the TV in Tripoli.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Five boys were injured when a rocket landed near where they were playing football outside Benghazi's Benina sports stadium. The rocket is thought to have been fired from Ganfouda where IS and Ansar Al-Sharia militants and their allies in the Benghazi Revolutionaries' Shoura Council.

column6: Wershefana Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Fighting near Qasr Ben Gashir between armed men said to be from Wirshefana and Tarhouna.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Unconfirmed reports that the Tripoli Revolutionary Brigade (TRB) were fighting among themselves, with two TRB units clashing in Zawiat Al-Dahmani. However, it was also reported that the clash was between the TRB's 6th unit and a neighbourhood family. Local residents said that the TRB had burnt down a house on 15 October and that the owners, said to be part of a local militia, retaliated by attacking the 6th unit's base in the district.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On Oct 15th, 1 Airstrike by plane was carried out by unknown actors in Jufra against unidentified militants. Declared target was Convoy. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column16: AP; Eye on ISIS in Libya; Asharq AlAwsat
column17: Clashes erupted in Tripoli between militias loyal to a U.N.-backed government and those supporting a rival Islamist-oriented administration that had ruled Tripoli until March this year. A security source reported that ""clashes erupted between the Tripoli Brigades, which are affiliated with the [GNAs] Ministry of Interior and the supreme command, and the Presidential Guard forces (el-Marsa brigade) that turned against the Supreme State Council. The militia responsible for guarding the Presidential Palaces announced its defection from the High Council of State (HSC) to Khalifa al-Ghwell and his supporters. Some fighting reported in Busetta.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On Oct 16th, in Derna, 2 Airstrikes by plane were conducted by Military Forces of Libya against the Shura Council. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reports of fatalities.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes continued on 16 October in Tripoli as gunfire was heard in Bab Ben Gashir near the Rixos between militias supporting Khalifa Ghwell and Tripoli Brigades.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A camp for Tawergha displaced people, at Al-Fallah neighbourhood in Tripoli, came under direct fire that killed one woman and wounded six other people including children. Exact date not given.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: In three days, US aircraft struck 96 targets in the course of 36 sorties against IS positions in Sirte. No definitive report on casualties, but at least 8 reported dead in latest offensive. Fatalities divided between 16, 17 and 18 October.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: In three days, US aircraft struck 96 targets in the course of 36 sorties against IS positions in Sirte. No definitive report on casualties, but at least 8 reported dead in latest offensive. Fatalities divided between 16, 17 and 18 October.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A Mortar hit Benghazi ON 17 October killing a child and wounding six more civilians. Army shelled Ganfuda district in response.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A Mortar hit Benghazi ON 17 October killing a child and wounding six more civilians. Army shelled Ganfuda district in response.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: In three days, US aircraft struck 96 targets in the course of 36 sorties against IS positions in Sirte. No definitive report on casualties, but at least 8 reported dead in latest offensive. Fatalities divided between 16, 17 and 18 October.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A former Libyan Airlines' chairman and CEO is reported to have been seized by armed men in Tripoli. He was later released on 7 December with little detail of the attackers or the motive.

column6: JEM: Justice and Equality Movement
column17: Thirteen members of Sudan's Dafuri rebel group, the Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) are reported to have been killed on 20 October after being attacked by a Salafist militia from Kufra near the oasis town of Jaghboub.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Amaq situation report stated that four IED attacks have been carried out in the area of the Ajjaj intersection and near the Tabiqa petrol station in Zahir near Sirte, during the past 15 days without further specification.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Fighting between pro-government forces and Islamic State militants in Sirte. Four Bunyan Marsous (BM) fighters were killed. According to the BM Operations Room, 20 militants were killed in the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Clashes reported in Gwarsha district of Benghazi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Armed men attacked an overcrowded dinghy carrying refugees off Libya, leaving at least four dead and up to 25 missing. North of the port of Sabrata, a speedboat bearing the Libyan coastguard insignia arrived and tried to steal the dinghys outboard engine as well as beating some of the migrants with sticks. The Libyan Coast Guard denied involvement in the attack.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: An IED planted by ISIS struck a civilian vehicle near Gate 40, killing the father who drove the car and injured the rest of his family severely.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Fighting between pro-government forces and Islamic State militants in Sirte. Militant casualties were reported but no official figure was given (10 recorded). Three US air strikes also reported against IS positions.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A Palestinian teacher was killed and his wife and family injured by a land mine or an IED as they drove to Sirte. Exact date not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Pro-government forces on 22 October said they had seized a group of buildings in a northeastern district of Sirte after three days of fighting against IS militants. Six pro-GNA fighters were killed in the city. 13 foreigners held by the Islamic State were freed.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: ISIS Amaq News Agency reported that an IED detonation destroyed a vehicle that carried Bonyan al-Marsous, Operation Solid Structure fighters (unconfirmed).

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Ten Bunyan Marsous fighters were killed in Sirte as the last five apartment blocks in the 600 complex were wrested from IS control after several days of fighting. One US air strike was reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Explosions were reported on 23 October on boats belonging to the BRSC at Misrata port. Two vessels were sunk in Misrata where they were tied up to a quay belonging to LISCO, the Libyan Iron and Steel company.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A brigade 302 army mine clearance specialist died and four of his companions were injured when a device they were defusing exploded close to Ganfouda on 24 October.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Libyan pro-government forces (Operation Solid Structure) fighting the Islamic State (IS) in Sirte freed 24 civilians on 24 October who were held captive by IS.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Oct 24th, in Sirte (Giza neighborhood) 4 Airstrikes by plane were conducted by Military Forces of US against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. 0-7 militants were killed.

column6: Wershefana Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Three Zawia men were murdered on 25 October. A Wirshefana gang has been accused on the killing the three civilians at Syed between Zawia and Janzour.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: An IED explosion targeted a unit of Bonyan al-Marsous (Operation Solid Structure) forces assigned with protecting the Coastal Road, damaging 2 vehicles and injuring one individual, the IED likely planted by ISIS's external cells operating on the outskirts of Sirte and its surroundings. Amaq reported that ISIS detonated 2 IEDs in the area destroying an armored vehicle and a technical, although no armored vehicle seems to have been involved in the incident as stated in the report.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Libyan Airlines announced suspending its flights for three days as of 26 October in protest against the kidnapping of its Chairman Fathi Al-Shatti in Tripoli by an armed group.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: ISIS claimed via Amaq to have destroyed a BAM technical (Operation Solid Structure) by detonation of an IED.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: On 28 October, the bodies of 10 unidentified men were found in a dumpster in Benghazi. The bodies bore torture marks and had gunshotwounds to the head. It was later reported that at least three of them were identified as members of Qaeda-linked Ansar al-Shariah militant group.

column6: Henish Clan Militia (Libya)
column17: Fighting reported in Zawyia. The clashes started after the Khadrawis accused Ibrahim Ahneish, one of the leaders of his clan, of selling three Zawiya men who were killed to the Wirshefana. Armed gunmen from the Saqr tribe, supporting the Khadrawis, then brought in armored vehicles and two tanks to attack locations belonging to Ahneish. Six killed over two days of fighting.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column16: Al Arabiya; Xinhua; AP; Libya Herald
column17: A car exploded in the eastern city of Benghazi on 29 October, killing six people. The explosion was in the downtown Benghazi district of al-Kesh. The victims included an anti-corruption political activist who supports the national army headed by Maj. Gen. Khlalifa Haftar, a Bangladeshi and an airforce officer. Conflicting reports about the nature of the explosion, with some saying that a missile had fallen on a car while others said that it was a car bombing.

column6: Henish Clan Militia (Libya)
column17: Fighting reported in Zawyia. The clashes started after the Khadrawis accused Ibrahim Ahneish, one of the leaders of his clan, of selling three Zawiya men who were killed to the Wirshefana. Armed gunmen from the Saqr tribe, supporting the Khadrawis, then brought in armored vehicles and two tanks to attack locations belonging to Ahneish. Six killed over two days of fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Two bombs are reported to have been dropped on the south eastern Tebu oasis of Rebyana on 31 October. A light border reconnaissance aircraft based at Kufra is said to have been used. No damage or casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A final round of strikes against Sirte was unleashed by U.S. attack helicopters on October 31. There were 33 hits on fighting positions, car bombs, an armament storage base and two control posts.

column6: Henish Clan Militia (Libya)
column17: Three gunmen from the Ahneish clan were killed in Zawiya.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The mayor of the oasis town of Traghen, 125 kilometres south of Sebha, was kidnapped.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column9: Police Forces of Libya (2016-) Criminal Investigations Department
column17: Two killed in assassination operation that targeted Mohamed Ben Aguila, the Chief of Sirte's Criminal Investigation Department, attack carried out by ISIS operatives.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US Marines used Super Cobra attack helicopters to mount close-range airstrikes against Islamic State militants in the Libyan city of Sirte.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column7: The Brigades of Revolutionaries in Libya
column17: A group calling itself 'The Brigades of Revolutionaries in Libya' held a small protest after Friday prayers in Tripoli's Martyrs' Square on 4 November demanding 'all good Libyans' reject foreign moves to resolve the country's political crisis. Instead they should unite behind national efforts to find a solution. Later, several armoured vehicles and men with weapons held a rally.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A would-be suicide bomber was shot dead on 4 November by soldiers in the Sabri district of Benghazi before he was able to detonate the explosives he was wearing.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A tribal leader was among four people injured when a car bomb exploded near a mosque in an area controlled by forces of the Libyan National Army (LNA) in the eastern city of Benghazi. The explosion occurred in Sidi Faraj, southwest Benghazi. The wounded tribal leader is from the Al-Magharba tribe.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: In Benghazi's Benina area, a house was slightly damaged in an attack aimed at the neighbouring airport. Another mortar landed in open ground. There were no casualties.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: The bodies of two members of what was 204 Tank Battalion were found near Al-Abyar, 50 kilometres east of Benghazi. According to a Libyan National Army (LNA) source, they bore signs of torture.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: The Misratah Central Hospital received the bodies of two members of the Solid Structure Operation forces as a result of clashes with so-called Islamic State (IS) group in Sirte. MENASTREAM reported it as an IED explosion on the Coastal Road near the Power & Desalination Plant, 1 injured.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column9: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: The Benghazi home of Al-Mahdi Al-Bargharthi, the acting defence minister in the Presidency Council's Government of National Accord, was set on fire after he give a press conference in Tripoli attacking the Libyan National Army and describing its forces in the oil crescent as foreign mercenaries.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Libyan pro-government forces (Operation Solid Structure) fighting the Islamic State group in Sirte evacuated 14 civilians from a battleground district of the city, they said on Sunday.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Attack on Tripoli's Rada (Deterrence) forces. Two members were shot dead on 6 November in a targeted attack outside a shop in Tripolis central Zawiat Al-Dahmani area.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Five people died as a result of clashes which erupted in Tripoli's western suburb of Siyahiya as a result a over a quarrel between Misratan and Amazigh militiamen from Jadu queuing at at a local money transfer agency. Amid the fighting, the money exchange office was set on fire and seriously damaged as were a number of other nearby buildings. Thieves meanwhile sacked a furniture showroom on the same street.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: A technical belonging the forces of Bonyan al-Marsous (Operation Solid Structure) destroyed by IED detonation killing and wounding occupants of the vehicle according to Amaq News Agency.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Clashes between Libyan National Army (LNA) forces and militants in the central districts of Sabri and Suq Al-Hout. Clashes also continued in Ganfouda.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Clashes between Libyan National Army (LNA) forces and militants in the central districts of Sabri and Suq Al-Hout. Clashes also continued in Ganfouda.

column6: Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin
column9: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
column17: The local superintendent of financial services form Maturba was kidnapped on 8 November in Derna. He had gone to Derna to organise state sector salaries. Members of his family claim that he was seized by the Derna Mujahideen Shoura Council (DMSC) and had been tortured. They did not say why he had been grabbed.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Unidentified attackers set fire to humanitarian supplies of the Red Crescent in their premises in Sabha.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: On the evening of 8 November members of an armed group physically attacked medical staff in the Abu Salim hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Clashes between Libyan National Army (LNA) forces and militants in the central districts of Sabri and Suq Al-Hout. Clashes also continued in Ganfouda. The LNA used both air and ground attacks to pound the militants' positions. According to an LNA source, one of the opposition's commanders was killed in Sabri.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: It was reported on 8 November that the LNA bombed Dernas Al-Fatayeh residential area, targeting houses and farms. The Derna Mujahidin Shura Council appealed for help to protect the civilians.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Students and teaching staff, and parents organized a protest in Tahala, Ghat in southern west Libya, denouncing the halting of schooling in the area.

column6: Henish Clan Militia (Libya)
column17: Clashes in Zawia between the Ahneish and Khadrawi families erupted again in Jamal Abdel Nasser and Omar Mukhtar streets, in the middle of the town.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 10th, in Sirte, 7 Airstrikes by plane were carried out by Military Forces of US against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Sporadic clashes reported between ISIS and BAM forces in Bu Hadi, according to local sources have ISIS increasingly managed to infiltrate some areas after som BAM-linked militias left.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Air raid in Ganfouda by Libyan National Army aircraft in which a family home was hit, killing the one man and seriously injuring the rest of the family. Two foreign workers, an Egyptian and a Chadian are also said to have been killed in the Ganfouda raid.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A young man was shot dead by gunmen on 11 November in Tripoli.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Air raids on Ganfouda and a shell landed near Benina while another also fell in Laithi. In both latter cases, there was again no damage done.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: A BAM technical (Operation Solid Structure) was struck by an IED near the Power and Desalination Plant on the Coastal Road. Likely to be the act of ISIS militants.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Air raids on Ganfouda and a shell landed near Benina while another also fell in Laithi. In both latter cases, there was again no damage done.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Militants in Benghazi fired six shells at Benina air base in reprisal for an air raid in Ganfouda by Libyan National Army aircraft in which a family home was hit.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Two Operation Bunyan Marsous/Operation Solid Structure fighters were killed in a landmine explosion 17km west of Sirte on 12 November.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Government of Libya (2014-) House of Representatives
column17: The head of Soloug's passport department died in a hail of gunfire when gunmen shot him as he was leaving his office.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A sit-in was staged in Tripoli on 13 November in solidarity with residents of Derna and the Ganfouda neighbourhood of Benghazi and urged an end to the LNAs sieges in both eastern cities and allowing the civilians to leave.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: ISIS claimed to have destroyed a BAM technical (Operation Solid Structure)near the Power and Desalination Plant on the Sirte Coastal Road

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The son of the Benghazi Defence Brigade, is said to have been killed in fighting in Ganfouda in the last two days.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Overnight launching of ten Grad missiles toward Benina airport. No casualties.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Demonstrations outside the HoR in Tobruk over failing desalination plant and water shortages.

column6: Military Forces of France (2012-2017)
column8: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
column17: Abu Talha al-Hassnawi, a key figure in al-Qaedas North African affiliate, was reportedly killed in his house in Gurtha Shati village near Sabha from a French airstrike. The attack left seven bodies completely charred so it was impossible to identify al-Hassnawi. A local official denied that he was killed in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The BRSC also reported targeting LNA artillery in Gar Younis and Guwarsha. A tracked vehicle was also damaged when it drove over a mine on the university campus at Garayunis. Though the vehicle was badly damaged, the driver was unharmed.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column9: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Libyan National Army (LNA) gained control over areas of west Benghazis Guwarsha and Ganfouda districts, it announced on 14 November. 20 LNA members dead and more than 30 others injured; the BRSC suffered five fatalities. Libya Herald reported the presence of the Omar Mukhtar Brigade in the fighting. (12 fatalities recorded).

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Libyan National Army (LNA) gained control over areas of west Benghazis Guwarsha and Ganfouda districts, it announced on 14 November. 20 LNA members dead and more than 30 others injured; the BRSC suffered five fatalities (13 fatalities recorded).

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Militants fired salvoes of rockets towards Benina airbase on 14 November.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Crowds burned tyres and protested against the demolition of two Marj homes mistakenly marked for demolition due to being built without permission.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Three soldiers were reported killed and eight wounded in clashes between Bunyan Marsous forces/Operation Solid Structure and Islamic State militants in Sirte.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A military funeral was car-bombed on 15 November in Benghazi killing a soldier and injuring at least 14 other mourners. The attack occurred at Kuwaifiyah cemetery in north-east Benghazi when a vehicle parked outside a park at Budezirah blew up. It is unclear if the explosives in the car were detonated remotely or if a suicide bomber was inside it.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column9: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: 10 LNA soldiers killed on 15 November in Quwarsha district in west Benghazi. 13 militants killed over three days. (17 fatalities recorded). The armed forces said they took control of and destroyed the Gwarsha town gate, which was used by Ansar al-Sharia.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Three senior defence ministry staff were abducted on 15 November in Tripoli. Gunmen grabbed the three officials at the Asshajara Hotel in Dahra where they had been staying. Two were released on 20 November.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of activists and civil society organisations have staged a protest in support of the students of Tahala town, in southwestern Libya, who have not started school yet due to the lack of teachers.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Conflict between the Awlad Suleiman and the Qaddadfa tribes in Al-Minshiya and Al-Mahdiya areas of Sabha. 15 dead in total. There are unconfirmed reports that the fighting began after a monkey owned by one tribal member bit a a rival tribesman. Fatalities divided between events in Sabha from 16-19 November.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Libyan National Army (LNA) made progress in the battle in south Benghazi's Ganfouda and Gwarsha districts and now fully controls Tripoli Road separating them, having destroyed all the militants' checkpoints along it.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A senior member of Haithem Tajouri's Tripoli Revolutionaries' Brigade (TRB) was killed on 16 November. He was reportedly found murdered in his car at Shara Al-Shatt (Corniche road) in Tripoli.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: 33 LNA soldiers killed on 16 November in west Benghazi. 13 militants killed over three days. (39 fatalities recorded - 33 soldiers and 6 militants).

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: One Bunyan Marsous Operations Room - Operation Solid Structure soldier from Kikla was killed in clashes and 16, all but one from Misrata, wounded in Sirte.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Property destruction: Islamic State militants set fire to a number of houses in Sirtes Giza district and were holding a number of families as human shields.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Conflict between the Awlad Suleiman and the Qaddadfa tribes in Al-Minshiya and Al-Mahdiya areas of Sabha. 15 dead in total. There are unconfirmed reports that the fighting began after a monkey owned by one tribal member bit a rival tribesman. Fatalities divided between events in Sabha from 16-19 November.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Libyan National Army (LNA) took ""full control"" of Benghazis western district of Gwarsha on 17 November after four days of fighting militants there. 15 LNA soldiers were killed and 43 wounded including an LNA field commander who was killed in a landmine explosion in Gwarsha.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The LNA moved forwards deep into Ganfouda from the east and took control of the customs warehouse where it found the bodies of 15 militants. In one attack against the Zawia Martyrs' Brigade at the customs warehouse, a tank crew from 204 Brigade died when the suicide vehicle exploded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 18th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 1 Airstrike by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No fatalities reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Three Iraqi Kurdish journalists travelling back from the front line at Sirte toward Misrata were kidnapped when their vehicle was intercepted. It is not known which militia grabbed them. They were released 30 hours later.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: 19 soldiers killed in Ganfouda in the last 48 hours and as many as 60 soldiers wounded. 4 militant bodies were found.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Conflict between the Awlad Suleiman and the Qaddadfa tribes in Al-Minshiya and Al-Mahdiya areas of Sabha. 15 dead in total. There are unconfirmed reports that the fighting began after a monkey owned by one tribal member bit a rival tribesman. Fatalities divided between events in Sabha from 16-19 November.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: At least four soldiers were killed by booby-traps as they worked their way forward from the Gwarsha Gate overrun two days ago.

column17: On Nov 19th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 6 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: For the last two days there have been regular air strikes on the area of Ganfouda in which BRSC militants are now confined.

column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Low-key fighting reported on 20 November in Benghazi.A would-be suicide bomber ran from his car after it overturned in a hail of gunfire. Three soldiers died today, one of them a mine clearer who was hit by a sniper and one militant reported dead.

column6: The Rapid Intervention Force
column17: Rival militias have fought each other in Tripoli's Hay Andalous in a dispute over who should be guarding the local branch of the National Commercial Bank. The frontages of the bank and neighbouring stores were damaged but there were no reports of any injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: For the last two days there have been regular air strikes on the area of Ganfouda in which BRSC militants are now confined.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Between 21-48 people were killed in fighting between Awled Suleiman tribal members and the Qaddadfa. tribe in Sabha this week. Lower fatality count recorded with 6 fatalities recorded on 20 November. Unconfirmed reports that gunmen from Sudan's rebel Justice and Equality Movement (JEM) were present fighting alongside the Qaddadfa.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Fighting in Sebha between the Alwad Sulaiman and Qaddadfa tribes continued.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 21st, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 13 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No fatalities reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A car bomb attack near a hospital in Libyas second city of Benghazi killed 2 women, 2 men and 2 children and wounded 23 others on 21 November. It was not immediately clear if the attack was a suicide bombing.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: The pro-GNA Operation Solid Structure forces said they managed to dislodge IS fighters from a fortified school in the Al-Giza Al-Bahriya district in Sirte. At least three members of forces loyal to Libyas internationally backed government were killed and 28 others injured.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: The US Africa Command, AFRICOM, conducted nine airstrikes against ISIS targets in Sirte on Tuesday. These latest hits bring the total number of airstrikes in support of what the US calls ''Operation Odyssey Lightning'' which began on 1 August to a total of 420 airstrikes.

column6: Awlad Suleiman Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Fighting in Sebha between the Alwad Sulaiman and Qaddadfa tribes continued. Fighting stopped late in the afternoon following mediation by elders and notables from across Libya.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: 40 Islamic State corpses reportedly found in Libyas Sirte as battle continues in the coastal area of Giza. Fatalities split between U.S. airstrikes and ground battles.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Gunfire was reported in Sabri district of Benghazi on 22 November, as Saiqa Special Forces moved into the area. Two boats, one of them apparently carrying fuel, may have been sunk in the engagement.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Scouts in Tripoli gathered outside the movement's headquarters in the centre of the city, vowing to protect it from what they claimed were illegal attempts to seize and demolish the building.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: On 24 November 2016, the Solid Structure Operations Room confirmed that it has taken control of 25 houses of those in which the remnants of the ISIL were barricaded in the remaining part of Al-Jizah al-Bahariyyah, the last stronghold of the organization in Sirte.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A family of four were murdered in their home in the Suq Al-Khamis district of Khoms. The father was beheaded and an inscription on the wall read ""Head of the Islamic State"". Investigators are torn as to whether there was IS involvement; some suspect it was a criminal act others believe it indicates an IS presence in the town.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A group of local activists demonstrated in Tripoli's Algeria Square over the deteriorating living conditions, inflation and lack of money.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 25th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 7 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column17: A group of local activists demonstrated in Tripoli's Algeria Square over the deteriorating living conditions, inflation and lack of money.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: An LNA aircraft bombed at Tebu-held position in Kufra district for the second time in a month. The attack was on Kilinja checkpoint some 350 kilometres south west of the Tebu village of Rebyana, itself 150 kilometres from the desert oasis town of Kufra. There were no casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: At least eight members of Libyan pro-government Operation Solid Structure forces were killed during a fresh offensive on Islamic State group holdouts in the stronghold of Sirte. 14 Islamic State militants were reported to have died. 30 houses reportedly seized by the GNA forces.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On Nov 27th, in Bani Walid, 1 Airstrike by plane was carried out by unknown actors. Declared target was Vehicle. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Protestors continued to stake out Algeria Square to protest the failure of the Presidency Council to stop the collapse in living conditions.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Protestors continued to stake out Algeria Square to protest the failure of the Presidency Council to stop the collapse in living conditions.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Tobruk airport was picketed by angry demonstrators today protesting a visit by UNSMIL chief Martin Kobler. Outside the terminal protestors held up placards saying that Kobler was not welcome in the town and that UNSMIL was responsible for Libya's fragmentation.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 29th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 4 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column8: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
column17: RADA forces attacked a camp near Suq Al-Juma held by the Benghazi Defence Brigades, themselves allied to Ghwell and ""radicals"" (some of them from Misrata) linked to Ghariani.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The army launched a major assault on the Ganfouda enclave in Benghazi. At least 20 tanks are reported to have been attacking from the west while LNA forces pressed forward all around the perimeter while naval vessels bombard from offshore. At least 24 soldiers were wounded including the commander of the 298 Tank Brigade and one man is known to have been killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On Nov 30th, in Sirte, Military Forces of US carried out 3 Airstrikes by plane against IS militants. Declared target was Fighters. Structure type hit was a Military target. No reported fatalities.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Clashes at the southern suburb of Qasr Ben Gashir, near the destroyed Tripoli International Airport, started after a Misratan unit there attacked Wirshefana forces in the area. This, though, this has not been confirmed.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Fighting in Libyas second city, Benghazi, where forces loyal to eastern commander Khalifa Haftar battled Islamist militias. Sporadic clashes and air raids around the besieged district of Ganfouda. A total of 11 people reported killed in two days of fighting (10 fatalities recorded on 1 Dec; 1 fatallity recorded on 30 Nov).

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes reported elsewhere throughout Tripoli- including Tajoura, Zawiya Dahmani, Rixos hotel (near the GNC presidential palaces where Khalifa al-Ghwell is managing his 'coup') and in Airport road just south of Tripoli in the area of Salaheddin.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes reported elsewhere throughout Tripoli- including Tajoura, Zawiya Dahmani, Rixos hotel (near the GNC presidential palaces where Khalifa al-Ghwell is managing his 'coup') and in Airport road just south of Tripoli in the area of Salaheddin.

column17: Clashes reported elsewhere throughout Tripoli- including Tajoura, Zawiya Dahmani, Rixos hotel (near the GNC presidential palaces where Khalifa al-Ghwell is managing his 'coup') and in Airport road just south of Tripoli in the area of Salaheddin.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A suitcase bomb exploded in a crowded area of Benghazi Medical Centre on 1 December which has been busy dealing with the wounded from the army assault on Ganfouda. Four people were injured.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes were reported around the Rixos hotel complex (near Al Nasr Forest, a city park) in Tripoli on 1 December. A convoy belonging to Haithem Tajouri's Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigades (TRB), which is in alliance with Ghneiwa and the RADA ('Deterrence') forces led by Abdul Raouf Kara, was seen during the day heading towards the complex in what is thought to have been a bid to eject the hardliners.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column17: A unit from the RADA (Deterrence) force headed by Adbul Raouf Kara, took over the Mahary Radisson Blu hotel in the centre of Tripoli; it was being used by hardliners. It also seized the nearby headquarters of the so-called 6th Division. Headed by Naem Duaibi, its has been part of the hardliners' military alliance.

column6: Abu Salim Brigade
column17: Rival militias clashed in the Abu Salim and Hadba districts of Tripoli. Heavily armed militias clashed in neighborhoods across the Libyan capital of Tripoli, leaving at least eight fighters dead. The local militia headed by local Abdul Ghani Al-Kikli (also known as Ghneiwa) were involved in fighting against a number of Misratan and other units supporting Ghwell.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Rival militias clashed in the Abu Salim and Hadba districts of Tripoli. Heavily armed militias clashed in neighborhoods across the Libyan capital of Tripoli on Thursday.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Various locations in Tripoli were secured by RADA Deterrence forces and the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade, including the Central Bank of Libya and the foreign affairs.ministry.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Heavy shelling was reported on the coastal Al-Jiza neighbourhood in Sirte. One member of the forces (Operation Solid Structure) was killed and two others injured in fighting that erupted inside buildings where Islamic State group fighters barricaded themselves.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: According to US Africa Command, there were three US air strikes all against militant positions in Sirte.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: There were sporadic clashes and air raids around the besieged district of Ganfouda.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: At least two females who seemed to be civilians surrendering to Bunyan Marsous forces, blew themselves up in Sirte after being brought inside BM lines, killing four Operation Solid Structure fighters and injuring more than a dozen others.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Libyan National Army lost four dead and 21 wounded in heavy fighting in Ganfouda as they claimed to taken three large blocks in the district, though they admitted that they had withdrawn from one area for ' tactical reasons'. A car bomb launched toward troops was destroyed before it reached its target.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes continued between heavily-armed militias in Tripoli on 2 December. Gun battles rocked the southeastern Nasr Forest district (city park) and adjacent neighbourhoods between militias vying for power and control over the city. The Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade, with the help of RADA forces, asserted that it had taken control of Camp 77 military camp next to the former Qaddafi compound in the capital's Bab Al-Aziziya area and the Al Nasr Forest area around the Rixos hotel.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Clashes continued between heavily-armed militias in Tripoli on 2 December. Gun battles rocked the southeastern Nasr Forest district and adjacent neighborhoods between militias vying for power and control over the city. The Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade, with the help of Abu Salim Brigade, asserted that it had taken control of Camp 77 military camp next to the former Qaddafi compound in the capital's Bab Al-Aziziya area and the Al Nasr Forest area around the Rixos hotel.
