column17: The Tarhouna Revolutionaries Brigade (Al-Kani Brigade), with support from Liwaa al-Sumud, the National Guard and the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council took over several areas near the municipality of Qasr bin Gashir. The Tripoli-based pro-GNA Special Deterrence Force was dispatched to the area in order to help locals fight the militias.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A 50-year old woman who was injured by a bullet in late August while walking through Sidi Hussein, died around 2 weeks later in the al-Jalaa hospital.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Movement of forces: The Libyan National Army (LNA) is sending reinforcements to Jufrah area, south of the Sirte area after reports of fresh Islamic State (IS) activity there.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: One resident of Zliten was taken hostage by unidentified gunmen.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants of Zliten closed the main road in the city to protest against the kidnapping of one of the inhabitants of the city.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Islamic State-militants set up a checkpoint between al Jufra and Abu Grein.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On August 29, LNA conducted one airstrike targeting an unidentified armed group in Jufra.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On August 29, LNA conducted two airstrikes targeting a vehicle of the Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin in Derna.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Movement of forces: Militias from Misrata who ousted so-called Islamic State (IS) from Sirte late last year have arrived back in the city. The forces took over positions in Sirte to support units currently stationed there. Their arrival comes after reports of a renewed IS presence to the south of the city.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: One resident of Shehata was taken hostage by unidentified gunmen. The man was beaten and taken to an unknown location.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A body has been discovered in Benghazi, bringing to at least six the number of such victims in the city in the last ten days. Five corpses were reported dumped in a small park in the city last week. All the dead had their hands tied behind their backs, had been beaten and reportedly showed signs of torture. There are suggestions that these are revenge killings for former links with militants when they controlled the Leithi district.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A parked VBIED detonated near a checkpoint in Nofaliya killing 2 policemen and 2 LNA soldiers. Others were wounded

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Units of the Libyan National Army (LNA) clashed yesterday with militants from the Islamic State some 90 kilometres east of Sirte, near Harawa. Air force jets were brought in to attack the force and claim to have destroyed three vehicles and killed a number of fighters.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On August 31, LNA conducted one airstrike targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: ISIS reported that their fighters ""took control of El Tesseyn"" (halfway Harawa-Nofaliya) and held an Eid prayer in its mosque.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: ISIS activities increasingly overt & daring, accumulating reports of movements east of Sirte & possible Command post near ""Om el-Gendell"", North from An-Nawfaliyah.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Agreement: Three Azerbaijani nationals captured by militants after they scuttled their small coastal tanker off Sirte 18 months ago and then held first by the so-called Islamic State, then by Bunyan Marsous (BM) from Misrata, have been released and flown home. The Misratan militia continued to hold the men on suspicion that they were ISIS members.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: IS had withdrawn to the southwest from areas it had entered to the east of the group's former stronghold of Sirte following LNA-air strikes the previous night. The area that IS had entered had not been under LNA control, but was instead held by forces from the al-Bunyan al-Marsous-forces, which had been tasked by the UN-backed Tripoli-based Government of National Accord (GNA) to fight IS in Sirte in 2016.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: IS had withdrawn from areas it had entered to the east of the group's former stronghold of Sirte following LNA-air strikes the previous night.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: ISIS took control of Wadi al-Ahmar, east of Sirte

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: ISIS reportedly abducted three civilian Salafists, described as Madkhalis, which are normally known to be allied with Haftar forces.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: LNA announced that direct and price strikes were launched against ISIS targets near the Ain Taqaraqat area, in central Libya. No number of fatalities was given.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Militants from Misrata set up a checkpoint 20km East of Sirte, after reports of ISIS activity in the area.

column6: Zawiya Martyrs Brigade
column17: Movement of forces: The Zawiyas Martyrs brigade conducted a combing operation in Wadi al-Ahmar after Daesh elements were seen in the area.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: People from Kufra protested in front of the health center to denounce the deteroriating health conditions in the city.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: While trying to flee from Saiqa-forces, a militant from the BRSC stepped on a landmine that other militants from the same group had put in place recently, and died.

column6: Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin
column17: The imam of a mosque in al-Bayda was reportedley killed by the Shura Council of Darna Mujahedeen as he returned to his family home in Darna for Eid el-Adha.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A teenager was injured by an IED in Benghazi. The Libyan National Army warned residents from reentering their homes without attention as many landmines were put in place by the now defeated BRSC.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On September 6, LNA conducted two airstrikes targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A neurologist was stabbed by a soldier from the LNA on Wednesday. The neurologist was heavily injured. The director of the hospital called on the LNA to arrest their fellow soldier.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Sporadic armed clashes broke out between youths of the Qadhafi tribe and gunmen from Misrata in Sirte last night, injuring an elderly woman inside her home in the popular neighborhood. Earlier, gunmen belonging to one of the military battalions in Misrata raided the house of a member of the tribe of Qadhafi in the district to arrest him.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: On Wednesday, employees of the Central Bank of Libya organized a protest in front of the bank's headquarters in Tripoli, denouncing the kidnapping of the director of the information technology department at the bank by unknown persons. It was later revealed that the director was arrested by a militia on criminal charges, in accordance with the law.

column6: Tabu Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Movement of forces: An independent force from Qatrun consisting of army soldiers, revolutionaries a volunteers, and led by a veteran Tebu militia leader, claim to have closed the Southern border. A source claimed that the Tebu-commander was hoping to be paid by the Europeans for his actions.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: Five individuals have been assassinated/executed in Ajdabiya after Saiqa-commander Warfalli arrived in the city. He is said to be involved in the executions.

column6: Military Forces of France (2017-)
column17: On September 7, France conducted three airstrikes targeting an unidentified armed group in Ubari.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Military battalions belonging to the command of the Tobruk military area found at dawn Friday the bodies of 13 Egyptian migrants near the al-Jaghbub oasis, south of Tobruk. It is not clear who is responsible for the death of the 13 Egyptians.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A Chadian national was killed by a landmine explosion in the Sabri area of __the eastern city of Benghazi. Landmines are mostly remains of the BRSC after having been defeated.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The Tanarut Libyan Creativity Society announced its suspension of activities in order to preserve the safety of its members due to the repeated attacks on the headquarters and its members in the city of Benghazi.

column6: Police Forces of Libya (2016-)
column17: Family members of Ibrahim Jadhran were kidnapped from their residence in Tripoli by the ""Special Deterrent Forces"" belong to the Ministry of Interior. Former militia-leader Jadhran said that his family members had been subjected to ""intimidation and espionage, forcibly taking them to an unknown place and hiding them there.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Movement of forces: Daesh elements and movement were reported in Harawa.

column6: Military Forces of Algeria (1999-)
column17: Property destruction: General Directorate of Desert Patrols says the Algerian army made a foray into Libyan soil and destroyed several checkpoints there.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A child lost his legs when a landmine exploded in al-Sabri area in the eastern city of Benghazi. Landmines are mostly remains of the BRSC after having been defeated.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On September 9, LNA conducted two airstrikes targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On September 9, an unknown aircraft targeted a vehicle of an unidentified armed group in Murzuq.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Three young men were killed after being chased by a car droven by unidentified armed men in the Tahlia area (Al-Sahel) in the city of Al-Khums (120 km) east of the Libyan capital Tripoli.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Employees of the General Authority for Culture of the Government of National Reconciliation protested at the headquarters of the Commission in Tripoli, to demand the demission of the Chairman of the Steering Committee of the Authority, to protest the closure of the Dar Al-Fagih Hassan centre and other assaults on cultural institutions. The protestors Tripoli's Rada ('Deterrence') force for forcibly closing the centre and ejecting staff.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of young people and residents of Al Ghuraifa municipality in Wadi Al-Ajal organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: Movement of forces: Special forces of the LNA arrived in Bin Jawad and Ras Lanuf to be prepared against Islamic State elements near the city. The LNA also moved in the direction of Harawa and Wadi al-Ahmar due to recent reports of Islamic State activity there.

column6: Police Forces of Libya (2016-)
column17: Arrests: Imam Abdul Razzaq Musheireb from the Bin Nabi Mosque in al-Sareem street has been arrested by authorities. He is accused of sending youth to tension hotspots and said to be close to Tripoli Mufti Gharyani.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Eyewitnesses said that one person was killed yesterday by unknown gunmen, near the post of El Salamani junction in the city of Benghazi. It is not clear whether the act has a political or criminal background.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants of Benghazi protested to demand the dismissal of the mayor, making him responsible for the accumulation of garbage in the city.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: An ophthalmologist was kidnapped in Tripoli. The victim was seized in front of his house by unidentified gunmen, bundled into a vehicle and driven away.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A man and his 10-year-old son were wounded on Tuesday by a landmine in Sabri area in central Benghazi. LNA-forces are controlling most of Benghazi. However, the remaining militants, who depend heavily on landmines, are still stationed in a small area in central Benghazi. The mines are said to have been put into place by them.

column6: Nalut Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Forces from Nalut kidnapped 15 Tunisians as a bargaining chip to demand the release of one Libyan citizen who was arrested by Tunisian security forces some weeks ago in the border near Dhehiba. 12 of the 15 Tunisians were released, though 3 Tunisians and the Libyan citizen remain in detention.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of young people and residents from Bint Baya organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of young people and residents from Obari organized a protest against the deteriorating living conditions, and demanded the provision of basic commodities.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The security guard of the General Authority for Culture reportdely kidnapped the Administrative and Financial Affairs Officer of the General authority for Culture of the Government of National Accord, Kassem Badi, on Wednesday morning, in the capital Tripoli. He was later released, being in good health.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Two militants from the BRSC were killed as forces of the Libyan National Army advanced towards one of their last positions near the City Hotel in Benghazi. One officer and two soldiers were injured. One soldier later died from his wounds.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On September 14, LNA conducted two airstrikes targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A car explosion near the passport office in Budzira, Benghazi left 5 security guards injured. No one has claimed responsibility for the explosion.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Youth and elders protested outside the interim governments offices near Beida against the decision to suspend the mayor of Shahat Obeidallah and threatened strife. Military governor Nadouri then reversed the decision and put the mayor back in place.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A mine explosion Sabri area in central Benghazi resulted in the death of one man. The mines are said to have been put into place by the Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaires, who are still remaining in a small area of Benghazi.

column6: Police Forces of Libya (2016-)
column17: Agreement: Family members of Ibrahim Jadhran were released after having been kidnapped by the Special Deterrent Forces that belong to the Ministry of Interior of the Government of National Accord.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The civil registrars office in Sabha was stormed by unidentified gunmen who attacked the supervisor. Due to the event and ongoing verbal attacks the office decided to close its gates.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: A LNA-soldier from the special forces shot and injured a policeman in Masakin in Benghazi.

column6: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Security Measures: Libyan authorities have sealed the border crossing of Ras Gadir with Tunisia amid intense clashes in the nearby city of Sabratha.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: The Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, who controls almost half of Sabratha, clashed with a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. Five people were killed and eight others injured. The former trafficking militia who reportededly switched side to cooperate with international migration authorities, earlier that day intercepted nine boats carrying undocuments migrants from another Sabrathan militia. This seems to be the reason for the clashes.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: For the second consecutive day, the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, who controls almost half of Sabratha, clashed with a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. A security officer was killed several others were injured

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Clashes reportedly took place between LNA forces and the remains of the BRSC nearby the City Hotel in Benghazi. At least 1 soldier died.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: LNA forces established a security basis/checkpoint 150km south of Tobruk on the road to Jaghbub to extend control over southern areas and control smuggling and illegal migration.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A small group of demonstrators gathered in the centre of Misrata last night in support of Baset Igtet, ahead of his proposed rally in Tripoli's Martyrs' Square on 25 September. Numbering less than 50 and said to be mainly refugees from Benghazi, they expressed support for him, condemning Haithem Tajouri's opposition to the rally.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: Unidentified gunmen shut down a fuel pipeline in the western Libyan city of Zawiya that feeds the capital Tripoli.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Property destruction: Houses belonging to Salam Jathran (ex-mayor) & ASC (Amazigh Supreme council)-linked Bonowara-Zwai family in Ajdabiya burned by LNA-affiliated militiamen.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: For the third consecutive day, the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, who controls almost half of Sabratha, clashed with a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. 70% percent of the residents fled the city. At least one person died.

column6: Zaghawa Ethnic Militia (Chad)
column17: The Zaghawa Tribe attacked the Tmassa gate 400km North of the border, supervised by Tebu groups, due to the recent closure of the border. 5 people from the Tebu tribe died. The Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Three civilians were killed Tuesday in a landmine explosion in the Sabri area of __Benghazi as they entered their houses. The mines are remnants of militants that were occupying the area some weeks ago.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The employees of the Labor Bureau in Sabha announced the suspension of their work, as of Tuesday, in protest against acts of theft and vandalism that targeted the office several times.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: A grenade was thrown at the entrance to the Saiqa Special Forces building in Benghazi's Buatni district this morning. No one was hurt and damage was slight. The Toyota driven by the assailants was later found and seized by Special Forces troops.

column6: Tabu Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Armed clashes broke out in the town of Umm al-Aranab (150 km) south of Sabha town between the Tabu tribe on the one hand and armed members of the the Chadian Zaghawa tribe on the other. The armed clashes continued since Wednesday, because of a recent attack by an armed group belonging to the Zaghawa on the gate of Tmassa (230 km) southeast of Sabha. The sources said that the attack on Tmassa was against the backdrop of the closure of the Libyan-Chadian border. However, the Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: One of the members of a mediation delegation that entered Sabratha and succeeded in negotiating a ceasefire, was shot and injured in the abdomen and was transferred for treatment in Tunisia.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Several people were kidnapped in the last few days in Obari. The most well known victim is the head of the regional offices of the Commercial Bank.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Despite a ceasefire, clashes took place in Sabratha for the fourth consecutive day, between the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, and a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place in Sabratha between the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, and a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The explosion of a landmine in al-Faakat area in Benghazi killed a child and injured three others.

column6: Tabu Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: Armed clashes broke out in the town of Umm al-Aranab (150 km) south of Sabha town between the Tabu tribe on the one hand and armed members of the the Chadian Zaghawa tribe on the other. The armed clashes continued since Wednesday, because of a recent attack by an armed group belonging to the Zaghawa on the gate of Tmassa (230 km) southeast of Sabha. The sources said that the attack on Tmassa was against the backdrop of the closure of the Libyan-Chadian border. However, the Zaghawa also reacted to a siege by Tebu militias on a Chinese company in Umm el Araneb where militants from the Zaghawa tribe are based.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The explosion of a landmine in al-Qawarisha led to injuries. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the BRSC in the areas.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Workers of the municipal council suspended their work in the municipality until the availability of fuel supplies and stations and in support of youth protests that took place in the area last week.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A group of civil society activists and residents of Sabha organized a protest rally in Sabha after the Rada-Forces (Libyan MoI) kidnapped/'arrested' two members of a Southern delegation that was on its way to Italy.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place in Sabratha between the Brigade of the Martyr Ahmed Al-Dabashi, also known as al-Ammu militia or 48 Brigade, and a militia loyal to the Government of National Accord. A commander of the Dabbashi-militia is said to have been killed. A Libyan couple were also killed when a shell hit their car as they were fleeing from the heavy fighting in Libya's western city of Sabratha.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Property destruction: The house of the commander of the border sector Colonel Bashir Boudefira in Ajdabiya was burned by unknown men.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi
column17: The Libyan Air Force claimed to have conducted airstrikes against an SDB (Brigades for the Defence of Benghazi) column in Saddadah.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: US forces carried out six ""precision air strikes"" against an Islamic State camp 240km Southeast of Sirte, killing 17 people. Air strikes were conducted in coordination with Libya's Government of National Accord.

column6: IFOR: ISIS Fighting Operation Room
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: In continuing clashes today in Sabratha, it is reported that the forces of the GNA-linked Anti-ISIS Operations Room (AIOR) in Sabratha has taken control of the downtown Qamar Hotel, killing three members of the rival Dabbashi-militia (aka 48 Briagade/Amu-militia) in the process.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Between 17-25 September, at least 17 people died in the clashes.

column6: Tripoli Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: The battalion Sobhi al-Marghani clashed with another unidentified group in Khallat Farjan in Tripoli. A 24-year old civilian was killed by a sniper in the crossfire.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A woman was abducted by unknown gunmen in Al-Rahba, Benghazi. She was released several hours later.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Misratah inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Nalut inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Clashes broke out between the Libyan National Army and elements of the Shura Council of Derna Mujahedeen after the LNA was monitoring their movements on the axis al-Fatayeh-Martuba.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Pro- and counter-demonstrators of Swiss-based Libyan businessman and former Presidential Candidate Igtet clashed on Tripolis martyrs square with fistfights. Security forces intervened and separated them with dozens of vehicles. The pro-demonstrators initially gathered in Tripoli to show their support of Igtet who had called on people to protest.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Az Zawiyah inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Sabha inhabitants went to the streets to show their support with former Presidential Candidate Abdel Basit Igtet who had called for protests on 25 September in Tripoli.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Between 17-25 September, at least 17 people died in the clashes.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Residents of Bani Walid staged a protest in commemoration of the drama when armed militias stormed the town 5 years ago, following a decision by the General National Congress. The residents of Bani Walid demand that the House of Representatives investigates the decision and criminally pursues its perpetrators.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Head of the Radiology Department at the Sabha Medical Center, Mohammed Senoussi Hamza, was kidnapped. He was released three days after his abduction.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Truckers in Abu Issa have held a protest against being forced to bribe their way through militia roadblocks or face long delays on the route from Tripoli to Tunisia. If they did not pay 'fees' at checkpoints on the road, they were turned back or held up. This included at the border itself where the truckers claimed that unless they were prepared to pay, they were not able enter Tunisia.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: One of Baset Igtet security advisers was shot outside his home in Suq al-Juma. He was part of the welcoming group for Igtet on his arrival at Mitiga airport. The family say that he was killed while he was cleaning his gun. There are other claims, however, that he was followed home and shot.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a worker from the Ras-Lanuf oil terminal. He reportedly fought among the Petroleum Facilities Guard of Ibrahim Jadhran some months ago.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On September 26, the U.S. conducted two airstrikes targeting Islamic State militants in Sirte, killing five individuals.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Clashes broke out between the Libyan National Army and elements of the Shura Council fo Derna Mujahedeen. Several artillery shells were fired by both sides.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Security Measures: Sirte Protection Force established several security posts after receiving information about the infiltration of members of the Da'ash organization into the center and suburbs of the city. The checkpoints are spread through the entrances of the city in the areas of Dhahir, Saffran, the second residential neighborhood, the Corniche, Swawa, Abuhadi and AbuZahia and the entrance to the South Gate. The sources pointed out that the checkpoints are manned by gunmen, asking for ID cards of motorists.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unknown gunmen kidnapped the head of the media unit in Ajdbiya. He was released some days later.

column6: Zawiya Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Change to armed group: The Security and Stability Operations Room was set up by Abu Obeida Al-Zawi, a militant Islamist commander from Zawia. It claims to be a neutral force to ensure a cease-fire but is widely seen as reinforcements for the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi.

column6: IFOR: ISIS Fighting Operation Room
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. The operations room has reportedly taken over Sabratha hospital. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

column6: Wershefana Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A supposedly Wirshefani pro-LNA force, dispatched to Sabratha to reinforce allies, was being attacked by Gharyan brigades northeast of Gharyan and forced to retreat. However, the Sabratha source disputed this, saying that no outside forces had been heading to the town.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A soldier from the Libyan National Army was wounded in clashes with the remnants of the Benghazi Shura Council of Revolutionaries that is still active in some houses near Sidi Khribish in As Sabiri al Gharbi in Benghazi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Two security guards that were guarding Sabha hospital were killed by unidentified gunmen. Weapons were stolen.

column6: IFOR: ISIS Fighting Operation Room
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. The operations room has reportedly taken over the Sabratha roman ruins. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On 28 September2017: In Brak Al-shati, an armed clashes were reported between the 116th and 160th Brigades of the Libyan National Army over Sabha oil depot. No casualties reported

column6: Sabha Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: In south Libya, clashes reported between the 116th Inf batt & the 8th near the oil warehouse of Sabha. The latter is accused of corruption.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: The US military has carried out more air strikes against the Islamic State group in Libya, killing several fighters, the US Africa Command said Thursday. The strikes hit about 160 kilometres southeast of Sirte (recorded as Jufra)

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-)
column17: On September 28, Egypt conducted three airstrikes targeting vehicles of an unidentified armed group on the Libyan-Egyptian border (coded as Jaghbub at geoprecisions 2).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unknown gunmen killed a citizen in front of a cafe in the town of Haraba close to Jabal Nafusa.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On September 29, the U.S. conducted one airstrike targeting Islamic State militants in Sirte, killing two individuals.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

column6: Zawiya Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: A newly formed militia (""Security and Stability Operations Room"") led by a commander from Zawiyah kidnapped a wounded fighter from the Anti-IS Operations room in an ambulance heading to Tripoli.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Protesters closed the main road connecting the town of 'Harraba' in Mount Nafusa and the capital Tripoli, in protest at the killing of a citizen by masked bullets in front of a cafe in the town.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unidentified gunmen assassinated four members of a reconciliation delegation from the Warfalla tribe near the town of Mezda, 140 km southeast of Tripoli. According to one report they were on their way to Sabratha to talk part in mediation attempts between the 48th battalion and the Anti-IS Operations Room. Other reports, however, say that they were to join in reconciliation talks between the Mashashia and the Qantrar tribe or Zintan.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes between the Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi and a local militia (Anti-ISIS Operations room) belonging to the GNA continued. Another 9 reported killed between 26-30 September, bringing total to 26.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On September 30, LNA and/or Egypt conducted two airstrikes targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Intermittent clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the ""City Hotel"" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. 10 wounded and 1 killed over the five days fighting

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The teachers of the municipalities of Al-Kubba, Al-Aqraq and Al-Maqib in the east of the country called on the parliament to enact a law guaranteeing the rights of teachers and guaranteeing them protection during the course of their work, threatened with escalating measures and stopping the study during the new year.They organized a sit-in at the Al-Ikhlas high school in Al-Qubba on Saturday to demand a salary increase and provide health insurance for them.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Armed clashes continued Sunday evening between the Nawasi and the Tripoli Revolutionaires brigade in the Zawyet Dahmani area of __Tripoli. Clashes broke out after the TRP took control of the Headquarters of the Nawasi Brigade in the area of __Qarji, on Sunday evening, prompting the latter to attempt to control the HQ of the battalion of the Revolutionaries brigade near the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Zawiyat Dahmani.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Three people, including a civilian, were killed in fighting last night in Tripoli's Gurji district, west of the city centre, between the powerful Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade of Haithem Tajouri and the Nawasi Brigade. The clashes occurred late last night after Tajouri sent in forces to Gurji's Massara area to clear it of a Nawasi unit. The Tajouri force is said to have succeeded.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-)
column17: On October 1, Egypt conducted two airstrikes targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Sabratha Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Fights between the Anti IS Operations Room and the Dabbasi brigade continued. The clashes in Sabratha left at least 43 people dead in total.

column6: Qadhadhfa Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: A member of the Gaddafha tribe killed a fellow Gaddafa tribeman during a funeral of Warfala elders in Bani Walid. The reason for the killing was vengeance, as the victim killed the perpetrator's brother some years ago. The matter had never been settled.

column6: Sabratha Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Fights between the Anti IS Operations Room and the Dabbasi brigade continued. The clashes in Sabratha left at least 43 people dead in total.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Intermittent clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the ""City Hotel"" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. 10 wounded and 1 killed over the five days fighting

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On October 2, an unknown aircraft conducted one airstrike presumably targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Armed clashes continued Monday between the Nawasi and the Tripoli Revolutionaires brigade in the Zawyet Dahmani area of __Tripoli.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Property destruction: The old Passports and Immigration department building in central Tripoli Shara Sayidi was engulfed in fire. No one was hurt. There have been unconfirmed allegations that the fire was started deliberately in order to destroy evidence of a black market trade in Libyan passports.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants from Sirte demonstrated to celebrate the expulsion of Daech from the city and demanded from the GNA to compensate them and solve the housing crises, caused through the vast destruction of infrastructure and homes in the city.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: There were demonstrations in Sabratha on Tueday, with people declaring their support for the Anti IS Operations room (army and police) and opposition to the Dabbashi militia.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On October 3, the LNA conducted an airstrike in Sabratha.

column6: Sabratha Communal Militia (Libya)
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Fights between the Anti IS Operations Room and the Dabbasi brigade continued. One soldier from the former group died in the fights.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of angry citizens in the city of Tobruk, on Tuesday morning, placed large quantities of garbage bags in front of the headquarters of the municipal council, to protest against the Council's failure to address the garbage crisis after the closure of the main landfill.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column7: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A militia, reportedly elements from the Benghazi Council of Shura Revolutionaries that moved to Sabratha, attacked the commander of the Anti IS Operations room in Sabratha as he was visiting the battleground to ascertain for himself the validity of the before concluded ceasefire. No death resulted from the attack but one soldier was slightly injured.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Youth from the Southern Region took over a truck that was carrying meat to the Sharara oil field to show their dissatisfaction with fuel and gas supply, cash liquidity, employment and other issues.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Fighting erupted this evening near Gasr Ben Ghashir, next to Tripoli International Airport, between the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade and forces from Tarhouna. The reason for the clashes is also less than clear. Local reports say that Tajouri had launched a pre-emptive attack after being told that the Tarhouna forces were rallying to move against the capital.

column6: Sabratha Communal Militia (Libya)
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: Clashes on the outskirts of Sabratha, with reports of airstrikes against the Dabbashi brigade, which was said to have tried to launch a counter offensive in alliance with the Mohamed Al-Kilani brigade from Zawia. It was repulsed. The clashes in Sabratha left at least 43 people dead in total.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Intermittent clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the ""City Hotel"" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. 10 wounded and 1 killed over the five days fighting

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: At least four people were killed in an Islamic State group attack & bombing at the main court building in Misrata. Thirty-nine people were wounded. An exchange of fire followed the first explosion. Of the three attackers, one blew himself up, one was killed and one arrested. 6 fatalities divided between two events.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: At least four people were killed in an Islamic State group attack & bombing at the main court building in Misrata. Thirty-nine people were wounded. A 20-minute exchange of fire followed the first explosion. Of the three attackers, one blew himself up, one was killed and one arrested. The attack coincided with the arrival of IS detainees for a court hearing. 6 fatalities divided between two events.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A child was injured by a landmine explosion in the Bousaneeb area, one of the western districts of the eastern city of Benghazi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the Benghazi Council of Shura Revolutionaries.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Clashes broke out with light and medium weapon between two families after one person was killed.

column6: Sabratha Communal Militia (Libya)
column8: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: As part of a peace deal to finally end the conflict in Sabratha, the Dabbashi brigade, a LNA-battalion supporting the Anti IS Operations Room in Sabratha and other militias have withdrawn from the city. The Anti IS Operations room now controls the city.

column6: Battalion 42
column17: Fighting started in the evening in in Ain Zara district further south between the members of the 42nd Battalion and the Abdul Raouf Al-Jabari Brigade. The former are based in Ain Zara, the latter in Arada. Both are said to have been legalised by the Presidency Council's interior ministry.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Intermittent clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the ""City Hotel"" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. 10 wounded and 1 killed over the five days fighting

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Drivers of private transport trucks staged a sit-in and went on strike which is seen as major cause of the fuel crisis in the area.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Some 200 supporters turned up in Gharyan yesterday to meet and show support for Baset Igtet, the businessman who is presenting himself a new leader for Libya. He was in the mountain town south of Tripoli as part of his campaign to rally support across the country for what is being called his '25 September Movement' - the date of its inaugural rally in Tripoli's Martyrs' Square last month.

column6: Battalion 42
column17: Clashes between the Battalion 42 and the Abdul Raouf al Jabari Brigade, both affiliated with the UN-backed government in Libya's capital Tripoli. 4 killed and 17 injured. They clashed near Suq al-Juma.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Around 80 demonstrators in Misrata yesterday demanded the unification of Libya armed forces, the return of the police and an end to militias such as the Benghazi Revolutionaries Shura Council and the Benghazi Defence Brigades. Gathering in the city's main square they said they fully supported the Libya army and the country's other security forces. The protest came in the wake of Wednesday's deadly attack on Misrata's court buildings by elements of the so-called Islamic State.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Youth from the Southern region blocked access to the Elephant oil field in the South if their demands for employment & developped are not met. The rioters threaten to stage a sit-in in the oil-fields if there demands continue to remain answered.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Two military personnel of the Libyan government (Battalion 301) were killed by unknown gunmen on Saturday at a checkpoint southwest of the Libyan capital.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Several civilians were abducted by unidentified gunmen in Sabha.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A 20-year old man was killed and a 18-year old teenager was injured when stepping on landmines that are remnants of past BRSC-activities in Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Clashes took place between the Libyan National Army and the remnants of the BRSC near the ""City Hotel"" in As-Sabiri Al Gharbi, Benghazi. One soldier died, according to medical sources.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Local municipal council and HoR employees blocked access to the parliament in Tobruk through protesting, demanding payment of delayed salaries.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Owners of destroyed houses in Sirte protested in front of the destroyed Bank ""Al Wahda"". The protesters urged the GNA and the Municipal Council to speed up financial compensation and find alternatives to destroyed housing units.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On October 9, the U.S. conducted one airstrike targeting Islamic State militants in Sirte, killing two individuals.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On October 9, an unknown aircraft targeted presumed Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Local municipal council and HoR employees blocked access to the parliament in Tobruk through protesting, demanding payment of delayed salaries. On another note, angry citizens threw bags of garbage and rubbish in front of the Municipal Council to protest against the non-functioning waste-system, after the closure of the garbage dump.

column6: Brigade of the Martyr Anas al-Dabbashi
column17: The commander of a brigade from Zultan was reported killed in Al-Jmail when he and his colleagues were attacked by a local militia allegedly allied to Sabratha's defeated Amu Brigade. They were shot while travelling through the town. The commander died instantly; three others were wounded, one seriously, and were taken to Sabratha hospital.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Hundreds of protesters staged a protest rally outside the central bank of the city of Sirte to demand the renovation of the bank's building, which was badly damaged during the liberation of the city. They are furthermore demanding the transfer of the bank from its current place to the another place at the University of Sirte and denouncing irregularities in the call for bids to renovate the bank.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Two high-ranking militants, Al Noufli and Ibraik al-Misriya, from the Ajdabiya Revolutionaries Shura Council have been caught by Misratan security forces after a shootout with the group at a farm in Al-Saket near Misrata in which one person was killed and several others injured on both sides. The group from Ajdabiya surrendered after a battle. Another person died some days later of his wounds.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The teachers' union in the municipality of Sabha and the municipality of Wadi al-Buanyis organized a protest to emphasize the support and support of the General Union for Teachers.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The teachers' union in the municipality of Sabha organized a protest in Sabha to emphasize the support and support of the General Union for Teachers.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A group of some 50 or more demonstrators took to the streets of Sabratha after Friday prayers, demanding the replacement of the mayor, Hassen Dhawadi, and the entire municipal council.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of teachers organized a sit-in outside the headquarters of the teachers' union in Sirte to demand their ""rights"", as did their colleagues in other municipalities, being above all concerned with socio-economic conditions.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of activists and youths from Jabal al-Akhdar region organized a demonstration in the eastern city of Al-Bayda last night to emphasize ""their support for dialogue, social reconciliation and the return of displaced people inside and outside the country.""

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Two brothers from the Al-Abadlah tribe were kidnapped near Tripoli on their way to the capital. Kidnapeprs demand a ransom payment.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: An IS militant is captured by the LNA in Derna some time in October. The militant was responsible for beheading an LNA volunteer in 2015.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Teachers on Tobruk stopped working and staged a protest in front of the local HQs of the education ministry in Tobruk.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Two civilians, among them 1 Palestinian, were killed and 4 others injured when stepping on landmines in Benghazi. The landmines in the area are remnants of the activities of the Benghazi Council of Shura Mujahedeen.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unknown gunmen kidnapped a technical team belonging to the General Electricity company while carrying out maintenance operations in the area of __Qasr Ben Ghashir in the suburbs of Tripoli.

column6: Gharyan Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: An armed group of 120 Sudanese mercenaries, belonging to their country's Justice and Equality Movement clashed with security forces in Gharyan. They were later arrested and then sent to Tripoli.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Youth from the Ghararat region of Souq al Jumaa put up road blocks to prevent Rada-forces, with which they fought earlier that day at Mitiga airport, to penetrate their neighbourhood.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column17: Clashes took place at Mitiga airport between Abdelrauf Kara's Special Deterrence Force (Rada), nominally part of the MoI-forces of the GNA and armed youth from the Ghararat region of Souq al-Juma. Reports say that armed Ghararat youth launched the attack in response to Rada arresting one of their members and for drug-related raids on their neighbourhood.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column17: Clashes took place in Tripolis Ghararat district, next to Suq al-Jumaa, and at Mitiga airport between Abdelrauf Kara's Special Deterrence Force (Rada), nominally part of the MoI-forces of the GNA and armed youth from the Ghararat region of Souq al-Juma.

column6: Police Forces of Libya (2016-)
column17: Clashes took place in at Tripoli Port between Abdelrauf Kara's Special Deterrence Force (Rada), nominally part of the MoI-forces of the GNA and an armed group controlling the port. The Rada announced control over the port after the fights.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column17: Clashes took place in Tripolis Ghararat district in Suq al-Jumaa, and at Mitiga airport between Abdelrauf Kara's Special Deterrence Force (Rada), nominally part of the MoI-forces of the GNA and armed youth from the Ghararat region of Souq al-Juma. The Rada announced control over the area after the fights. Three people were killed and eleven others injured.

column6: Rioters (Libya)
column17: Rioters blocked the main road link at Al-Shawarif that links north and south of Libya, demanding the release of the leader of an armed group who has been arrested by the the Rada Special Deterrent Force of the MoI (GNA)..

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants from Qarabulli went on a general strike and announced to enter an open sit-in until all armed militias will have left the city.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On October 18, the U.S. conducted one airstrike targeting an unidentified armed group in Wadi Ashshati district, killing two individuals.

column6: Brak Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: The water supply in Tripoli and the surrounding area was stopped after a militia from Brak al-Shati turned off the valves of the 'Man-Made River' after its leader, Al Mabrouk Ahnish, was not released by the Rada (Special Deterrence Force) forces.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: Small group of ISIS fighters spotted roaming the area of Sultan, 60km east Sirte during the past two days.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants of Sabha protested calling for peace, stability and a cessation of war. They were carrying white flags during their protest.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a military colonel east of Sirte. The colonel was released the following day.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Heavy clashes broke out between two armed groups engaged in human smuggling at the 'Agricultural Project Brak', located 1km from Brak al-Shati, not far from Sabha.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Two militants of the Shura Council of Darna Mujahideen were killed in Dhahr Al-Hamr area south of Derna.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Workers from Mellita oil & gas complex organized a protest in front of the company to denounce the company's mismanagement & corruption. They ask the management for health insurance and to quickly pay their salaries.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of young people from Al-Jabal Al-Akhdar demonstrated in the city of Al-Bayda to emphasize their support for national dialogue ""without foreign commandments or intervention"".

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unidentified gunmen hit the Town Hall of Sirte with an RPG. No injuries were reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: 3 Egyptian workers were abducted in Tripoli by unknown militants.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: 1 Libyan civilian died and 2 others were injured in landmine explosions in different locations in Souq al-Hout, Benghazi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A man was kidnapped by unidentified gunmen and his dead body found a few days later in Ajaylat. Relatives were not able to pay a financial ransom that was demanded by the gunmen.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants of el-Manara neighbourhood in Sirte organized a protest to call on authorities to rebuild their houses that were destroyed during the civil war.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-)
column17: On October 23, Egypt conducted three airstrikes targeting vehicles of an unidentified armed group on the Libyan-Egyptian border (coded as Jaghbub at geoprecision 2).

column6: Surman Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Clashes between two armed groups in Surman took place after one of the two opened fire on the criminal investigation branch Al-Gharbia.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was injured in a landmine explosion in as Sabri al Gharbi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the BRSC.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Islamic State elements attacked the LNA at a checkpoint, 60km south of the city of Ajdabia, killing two soldiers and wounding four.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was killed in a landmine explosion in Khasm al-Kabash, near al-Maqrun West of Benghazi. Landmines are remnants of the activities of the BRSC.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Border Guards
column17: An unknown armed group attacked Brigade 456 that is working as a peacekeeping entity in Ubari. No casualties were reported. Brigade 456 belongs to the Border Guard and was appointed to secure Ubari in February 2016.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: 36 dead bodies were found in Al Abyar east of Benghazi. It is not clear who was responsible for the recent killings. The 36 were reportedly tortured before being shot in the head. Allegations exist that the victims were militants captured in Benghazi and subsequently held in military prisons of the LNA before being killed by them. The HRW later said that Haftar's forces were responsible for the killings.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: As fighting continues between LNA and BRSC militants in remaining pocket of Akhribish in Benghazi, BRSC says it killed a LNA fighter by sniping.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A protest rally was held by residents of Ajrah city to demand that the National Oil Corporation implement the promises regarding development that they made to the people of the city during their recent visit.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Protesters gathered in Sirte to call on authorities to expedite the compensation for their homes destroyed and damaged.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: Islamic State militants set up a checkpoint in Wadi Hanaywa, 55 kilometers east of Sirte, during the first hours of Sunday morning.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: Arrests: US special forces seized the second suspect in the Benghazi mission attack, Mustafa al-Imam, in Libya. Other info says that there was no actual operation and that the suspects were handen over to the US government by Libya Dawn militants who had already arrested them.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of activists and civil society organizations protested in front of the Jafar municipal council in Houn to demand the dissolution of the council and refer its members to the judiciary, accusing them of corruption.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: An airforce raid on Darna led to the death of 15 civilians. It is unclear whether the Libyan National Army or the Egyptian Air Force conducted the raid. Both deny responsibility. Mada Masr reported that it had been told by an Egyptian government source that the airstrikes were carried out by the Egyptian air force. Also the DMSC accuses the EG military of carrying out the raids.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-)
column17: On October 30, Egypt conducted three airstrikes targeting vehicles of Al-Qaida, Islamic State or civilians on the Libyan-Egyptian border (coded as Jaghbub at geoprecision 2).

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was injured as he stepped on a landmine in Ganfouda, Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: Saiqa-special forces clashed with elements of the Islamic State in the Sidra area west of Ajdabiya without causing any casualties.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: The funeral of 15 civilians who died in airstrikes the day before turned into a demonstration, with slogans denouncing the bombing of innocent women and children.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: On November 1, a 15-year-old Syrian boy was injured in his leg by gunshots in the Qweifiya area

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: A joint force consisting of members of the Special Operations Force, led by Major Imad Trabelsi, and a unit under Osama Juwaili, the PC's western region military commander, launched an attack on the 4th Brigade camp Azziziya. The two leaders are from Zintan. The 4th brigade consists of local militiamen, and is led by Omar Tantoush, head of the Wirshefana Military Council. The 26th Brigade camp and the Azziziya Training Centre are also reported to have been attacked. Attacks resulted in the death of a child.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Benghazi Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: Clashes took place between the 'Katiba Awliya al-Dam' from Benghazi and Ansar al-Sharia in Wadi al-Murqas near Ithrun, west of Darna. One casualty and several wounded.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Protesters in Azziziya denounced the Presidency Council for the attack that targeted their city the day before.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: In latest al-Naba, ISIS says a unit of its ""Cyrenaica Province"" repelled an attack by LNA on November 2, at an unspecified location in the desert, damaging an LNA vehicle and wounding a number of 'soldiers'.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian died as he stepped on a landmine when returning to his apartment in Misrata Street, Benghazi.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: A Libyan lawmaker and a number of his escorts were released on Friday after they were kidnapped in Tripoli by a militia allied with the GNA.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Armed militants abducted at least two Turkish technicians and a German engineer who were on their way from Obari airport to the local power station.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Residents of Darna held a protest after Friday prayers to condemn the airstrikes on the city that led to the death of 15 civilians on Monday.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: One LNA-soldier was killed and at least four wounded in an attack by armed gunmen on an army post on the road between Brak Al-Shatti and Jufra.

column6: Unidentified Military Forces
column17: On November 3, an unknown aircraft conducted one airstrike targeting a vehicle of an unidentified armed group in Al Aziziyah.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Two civilians were injured in a landmine explosion in Souq al-Hout.

column6: Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: MSCD targeted with artillery LNA positions in the area of al-Hila, south of Derna.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Pro Haftar group organized a Million man march in Benghazi to delegate him to run the country. Turnout was very low.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: An LNA officer died in a landmine explosion in Souq al-Hout as he tried to help injured civilians from an earlier explosion.

column6: Special Deterrence Forces
column17: Rada special deterrence force raided the comic con-event in Tripoli, arrested organizers, participants and visitors and beat several of them.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Staff at one of the stations in the Shahara oil field were attacked last night. Nobody was injured, although the engineers were beaten and two vehicles as well as mobiles were stolen.The incident, not known whether criminal or political, did not affect production.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Civilians were injured as they stepped on a landmine in Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: 3 soldiers died and 12 were injured when Saiqa-LNA units advanced to conquer the remaining pocket of Sidi Akribesh in Benghazi where BRSC militants are holding out for more than four months. One militant was also killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord; Al-Awaqir Ethnic Group (Libya)
column17: GNA deputy interior minister Faraj al-Gaem from the Awagir tribe was targeted by a car-bomb attack in Sidi Khalifa, Benghazi. The attack injured seven other people.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: An Egyptian citizen was injured on 5 November 2017 by a stray bullet in the Majouri area.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: An LNA soldier was killed and another one injured in a landmine explosion as they tried to rescue civilians who were injured as they stepped on a landmine in Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: LNA airforce flew strikes on militants in Sidi Akribesh, as Sabiri al Gharbi in Benghazi were remaining elements of the BRSC are holding out for more than four months.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was killed in a landmine explosion as he entered his old apartment in Souq al-Hout, Benghazi.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces in a southern suburb of Aziziyah. The forces took control of the suburb forcing Wershefana forces to retreat. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Border Guards
column17: On 06 November 2017: members of Libyan Military Coast Guard beat migrants with rope and pointed firearms at them during operation at sea in misratah. No casualties reported

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column9: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Leading BRSC member Mohammed Bakr Al-Yedri died in detention. Photograph's of his body in Misrata hospital mortuary showed signs of bruising and foaming at the mouth. Supporters claimed he had been subjected to electric shocks. The cause of death has not yet been determined.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A rocket attack (RPG) on Benghazi Radio's broadcasting studios slightly injured a number of people, including the poet Khadija Bsikri.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Angry protests took place outside Misrata's anticrime office following the death in detention of leading Benghazi Revolutionaries' Shoura Council member Mohammed Bakr Al-Yedri.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Clashes took place between Juwaili forces, a Zintani commander of the PC western military zone, supported by a militia from Zintan, and Wershefana forces in Aziziyah. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: The LNA reopened the Ain Ghazala gate (60 km west of Tobruk) in the Tobruk military area by setting up new headquarters and military barracks for the security services stationed at the gate. It was done to protect the area from the Gulf of Bemba West to Imsiad East and further south down to Jaghboub from incursions.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: Special Saiqa Forces took over the last pockets of the BRSC in Sidi Akribesh in Benghazi and announced complete control over Benghazi after clashes with the militants. Three soldiers and two militants were killed in the operation.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: A raid by LNA-AF Mi-35 reportedly targeted MSC sites in Dhahr al-Ahmar, south of Derna.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: MSCD says it repelled an LNA advance attempt in Dhahr al-Ahmar south of Derna, killing and wounding an unknown number of LNA militiamen in the process, among the dead allegedly a commander.

column6: Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column7: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya); Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Tripoli Revolutionaries Battalion (TRB), in coordination with the military council of Zintan, entered Al-Zahraa area in Warshefana at dawn on 8 November after fierce clashes with local militias. 40 combatants were killed and injured during the weeklong fights in and around Aziziyah.

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord; Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade
column17: Juwaili, Zintani commander of the Presidency Council western military zone, together with Trabulsi from Zintan and the Tripoli Revolutionaries Brigade of Tajouri took over Aziziya after a deal with Wirshefana militia commander Muamar al-Dhawi, a lifelong friend of Juwaili. The objective of the 6-day long military operation was reportedly to crack down on pro-Qaddafi forces in the area.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A police commander from Bayda, Ayman al-Hassi, was wounded and seized from his home by unknown gunmen. Hassi, in his role as head of the town's police investigation unit, has earnt a reputation for toughness against militias. He was released after 1 day in captivity.

column6: Police Forces of Libya (2016-)
column9: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: The Anti-Crime department of Misrata is accused of torturing and killing detained senior member of the BRSC Mohammed Bakir (aka Bee).

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: Islamic State elements set up a temporary checkpoint 70km south of Sirte to control cars passing by and confiscated food from trucks.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Deputy MoI of the GNA, Faraj Egems, headquarters were attacked by a rocket-propelled grenade, killing five security personnel and injuring at least three others. Egem accused the LNA of the attack although they denied responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: In the context of armed clashes between the army and militias loyal to Faraj Qa'id, on 10 and 11 November, civilian casualties were reported. Children were shot during their departure from school in the Salmani area, killing a 7-year-old boy and wounding a girl 11 years old.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Unknown gunmen kidnapped a man in Sirte named Usama Ahnish al-Baqar al-Warfalli.

column6: Ghat Communal Militia (Libya)
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Armed battles erupted near the Algerian border between security forces of the GNA and abductors responsible for the kidnappding of two Turkish and one German worker near Ubari last week. The abductors were arrested after the operation.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: LNA forces stormed and took over the headquarters of Faraj Eg'em, deputy MoI of the GNA, in Budzira district in Benghazi. Eg'ems forces fled to neighbouring Bersis which was attacked and seized by LNA forces later the day. Houses were destroyed by artillery and one officer of the LNA died.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: LNA forces stormed and took over the headquarters of Faraj Eg'em, deputy MoI of the GNA, in Budzira district in Benghazi. Eg'ems forces fled to neighbouring Bersis which was attacked and seized by LNA forces later the day.

column6: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column7: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Agreement: After at least 1 failed assassination attempt, another close call in Benghazi, and fights in Bu Dazirah and Bersis, GNA Deputy Minister of Interior Faraj Qaim turned himself in to LNA in al-Marj.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On November 11, LNA conducted one airstrike targeting Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin positions in Derna.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: In armed clashes between the army and militias loyal to Faraj Qa'id, on 10 and 11 November, civilian casualties were reported. Children were shot during their departure from school in the Salmani area, killing a 7-year-old boy and wounding a girl 11 years old

column6: Zintan Ethnic Militia (Libya)
column17: 28 bodies, showing traces of torture and mistreatment, have been found in the Western area of Wershefana, nearby Aziziyah where fights took place last week between Zintani militias supported by the GNA and Wershefana militias. A total of 70 people reported killed in week-long fighting

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Workers at Misrata International Airport shut down the airport through protests to denounce that they have not been paid their salaries for more than a year and half.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was injured when he stepped on a landmine in Gwarsha. He died later of his injuries.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: Three civilians were injured as they stepped on landmines in the outskirts of Sirte.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Inhabitants of Tobruk protested in Martyrs Square in Tobruk to show their support of the HoR as legislative authority and Haftar as head of a Libyan army, denouncing the GNA trying to create ""parallel institutions"" in Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On 13 November 2017: Libyan National Army affiliated fighters raided Libyan Al-Watan television station and seized equipment in Benghazi. They briefly detained and harmed two journalists as well. No casualties reported.

column6: Islamic State (Libya)
column17: Non-violent activity: Islamic State set up a temporary checkpoint 80km south of Abu Hadi to control cars of civilians passing by.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian died as he stepped on a landmine when he was returning to his house in al-Sabiri al-Gharbi, Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Operation Solid Structure said that members of its security forces had been ""lightly injured"" during clashes with an armed group in the Jarf area of Sirte. Eight militants were then arrested.

column6: Misratah Communal Militia (Libya)
