column17: Agreement: Ansar al-Sharia's Abrayek Maziq, former commander of the branch in Ajdabiya, and four others were released from Misrata prison.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Dozens of demonstrators protested outside the Libyan parliament in Tobruk to demand the dismissal of Omar Al-Bar'asi, head of the Audit Bureau, accusing him of financial and administrative corruption.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Presidential Guard
column7: Government of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
column17: Security Measures: The Presidential Guard of the PC secured the Tripoli-Zawia costal road, setting up a checkpoint on Forsan (27km) point just before Zawiya and at Sidi Billal in Sayaad.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: LNA Air Force carried out air raids on Islamic State (IS) sites near Harawa, killing dozens of militants.

column6: Unidentified Clan Militia (Libya)
column17: A clash between two families over land in Misratah results in 7 deaths.

column7: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column8: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries

column6: Shura Council of Darnah Mujahidin
column8: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Two soldiers died and one escaped when an LNA-patrol came under fire from militants south of Derna. When attacked, the patrol managed to move to cover but the militants detonated a mine which killed two of the three.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A well-known surgeon from the South was kidnapped by unknown gunmen in Sebha, Libya.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: On November 16, LNA conducted one airstrike against a camp of an unidentified armed group in Harawah.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column9: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction - Saiqa Forces
column17: Unknown men with light and medium weapons attacked a refugee center in Ganfouda to smuggle out a Sudanese national who was earlier detained. They were opposed by members of the anti-immigration agency until help from Saiqa-Special Forces arrived on the scene and arrested one of the perpetrators. The others managed to escape.

column6: BRSC: Shura Council of Benghazi Revolutionaries
column17: A civilian was injured as he stepped on a landmine in Souq al-Hout, Benghazi.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: American drones carried out airstrikes against ISIS in the Libyan desert without specifying where the strikes took place. Several fighters were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
column17: Security Measures: LNA units carried out extensive sweeps in the region known as the ""oil crescent"" in north Libya to monitor movements of IS members. Patrols were carried out with air support.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: The body of a family member the former Qaddafi-era Benghazi governor has been found near Saloug, south-west of the city.

column6: Janzur Communal Militia (Libya)
column17: On 19 November, branches of Janzur and Taghura of the Department of Combating Illegal Immigration broke into a temporary camp for migrants in the Mayan area, to arrest smugglers and other criminal elements. The use of firearms reportedly killed one and injured four others among male migrants.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: People of Tamanhint protest and demand the reopening of the airport to connect the city with the rest of the country. The demonstrators argue that isolation is leading to the region being left behind. At the same time, protesters demonstrate against the video of slave auctions on Libya's coast.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: The US military launch an airstrike against IS militants in Furqaha. No mention of casualties.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: Residents of Sabha protest and demand an increased security presence in Sabha. On the same day,doctors in Sabha hospital protest and strike after one of their members is kidnapped. It is unknown whether the kidnappers are a political or criminal armed group.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A woman was non-fatally shot by a random bullet in the city of Sabha.

column6: Protesters (Libya)
column17: A number of citizens, activists and jurists organized a demonstration in front of the House of Representatives in Tobruk to ask the council not to extend the mandate of the head of the Audit Bureau, Omar Abed Rabbo al-Barasi.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Libya)
column17: A source from the Libyan Red Crescent in Ajdabiya confirmed the discovery of a mass grave south of the city. The source said that they retrieved two decomposed bodies from the cemetery in the south of Ajdabiya, without disclosing the total number of bodies found in the cemetery.

column6: Military Forces of Egypt (2014-)

column17: On June 26, GNA forces backed by airstrikes fully recaptured the town of Gharyan from the LNA, the town functioned as the main forward operating base and harbored the central operations room. Nine GNA fighters were killed in the process of recapturing Gharyan while GNA forces arrested 150 LNA militiamen and mercenaries, and seized advanced weaponry, vehicles, drones, and other equipment. A number of wounded LNA militiamen were said to have been executed at the Gharyan Hospital and LNA acknolwedged that it lost 43 fighters.

column17: A grenade exploded near the stadium where President Rajaonarimampianina had been inaugurated. 1 child was killed & 52 people injured.

column6: Government of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Security Measures: President Rajaonarimampianina disbanded the Special Intervention Force (FIS) & the Territorial Security Directorate (DST), 2 controversial special security forces.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: An armed group attacked & robbed 5 homes & businesses in Ankadifotsy

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Supporters of ex-president Ravalomanana, the 'Zanaki Dada,' protested in Behoririka, calling for the release of political prisoners & and reopening of radio & television stations closed in 2009

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: A mob, including Fokonolona, took a man accused of murder from police custody & killed him in front of police officers in Andohanilaka

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: An army colonel & soldiers arrived in Ambilo village in Betsiaka (Ambilobe district) & declared they were taking control of a gold mine

column6: Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar)
column17: Fokonolona militia burned a man alive in Ambilobe, who had been accused of beating to death a man & raping a young woman.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Security Measures: Dahalo militia in military uniforms imposed a curfew in a number of villages in Befotaka-Sud

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked the village of Agnapotatra in Ambongo. 2 people were killed, 3 people were taken hostage & 90 cattle were stolen.

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: 15 Dahalo cattle rustlers were killed in clashes with paramilitary troops in Vangaindrano district

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked Vohipaho & roughly 80 cattle were stolen.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked Ranomena & roughly 200 cattle were stolen.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Police & armed bandits exchanged gunfire after a grenade was thrown at police officers in Antanimena

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: A grenade was discovered in Ankorondrano-Ouest (near Antaniavo Antohomadinika) & was dismantled

column6: Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar)
column17: Fokolona (residents of Ankonahona, in Ambohimitombo Ambositra) killed 3 suspected bandits who had attacked a household

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Police & armed bandits exchanged gunfire in Camp Robin (Ambohimahasoa district) after the bandits attacked the police vehicle. 1 bandit was killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: An Indian business owner was kidnapped from his home in Behoririka

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: A bomb was discovered at the Sainte Famille high school in Mahamasina

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Armed men attacked a Chinese business owner in Analamahitsy

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Police chased & arrested 4 armed men in Andranobevava, suspected of attacking a Chinese business owner in Analamahitsy. 1 man escaped.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Defusal: A bomb was discovered at a church in Manjakaray, similar to that discovered at the Sainte Famille school in Mahamasina

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: A makeshift bomb was discovered in Soavimasoandro

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Students & police clashed following a demonstration by students at the university in Antsiranana. Students threw stones & police used tear gas. 6 students were arrested.

column6: Foroche Militia
column17: Foroche youth attacked a teaching college & stabbed 6 students.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: A woman suspected of being a witch was beaten to death in Andrainarivo

column6: Fokonolona Communal Militia (Madagascar)
column17: Fokolona fired on civilians in Ambohibarikely Anosibe. 3 civilians were injured.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Clashes between Dahalo cattle rustlers and police over three weeks have led to the death of 34 people, mostly Dahalo.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Attacks in Manja over the past three weeks by Dahalo cattle rustlers have led to the death, injury, and kidnappings of civilians. 4 civilians killed.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Police and Dahalo fought each other in Ihosy - leaving 41 Dahalo dead and 4 civilians.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Conflict between Dahalo cattle rustlers, villagers and the security services led to numerous deaths, there were 22 total reported across the towns of Bechuka (sic) and Bwasarsud (sic); 275 houses were also burnt, and leading to about 3000 displaced

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Cattle thefts led to clashes between villagers, Dahalos, and authorities in Maromby commune, district of Amboasary South, in the region of Anosy. 275 houses were destroyed and 125 houses were set on fire during the clash. 22 people died.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Conflict between Dahalo cattle rustlers, villagers and the security services led to numerous deaths, there were 22 total reported across the towns of Bechuka (sic) and Bwasarsud (sic); 275 houses were also burnt, and leading to about 3000 displaced

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Conflict between Dahalo cattle rustlers, villagers and the security services led to numerous deaths, with 10 Dahalo and 5 villagers reported killed in Bwasarsud (sic)

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: In Bwasarsud, clashes between Dahalo and villagers led to 10 Dahalo killed and 5 villagers killed.

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: The National Guard increased their presence in the South of Madagascar by 150 personnel after fighting took place the previous week due to Dahalo cattle rustlers.

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: The Madagascar military has launched Operation ""Coup DArret"" in the southwest of the country in order to increase security following violence related to dahalo activities in the region

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Students from the Ecole Normale Superieure began a sit-in at the university, in protest over housing demands

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Community teachers gathered in front of the National Education Ministry and began a strike over unpaid salaries and recruitment

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: The government launched Operation ""Halt"" against Dahalo in southern Madagascar, mobilizing nearly 1,000 soldiers and heavily armed police to the area

column6: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Five Dahalo were killed by security forces during the ongoing Operation ""Halt"" in southern Madagascar

column6: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Dahalo ambushed a Madagascar gendarmes vehicle. None of the police were injured but two dahalo were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: The forces of Operation ""Halt"" reported they have killed 26 Dahalo since mid-June

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: 12 Dahalo were killed by elements of the Madagascar police in the deep forest of Befiamy, near the town of Marotsiraka (sic).

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: The forces of Operation ""Halt"" reported they have killed 35 Dahalo since mid-June

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked the village, killing three people and looting several homes; they also kidnapped a priest and three apprentices at the agricultural center, although they were confirmed released on July 10

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Students at the University of Vontovorona blocked the entrance to the village in the early morning with rocks and burning tires to draw attention to their demands for more support in their studies; police (Emmo Reg) arrived to disperse the protesters, using tear gas and rubber bullets; the protesters responded by throwing stones; one protester was arrested and four were injured by rubber bullets; the protesters allegedly vandalized and looted nearby merchants as well

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Clashes between students and police intensified, with stones being thrown and more tear gas fired by an increased number of security forces; a police officer was injured by a stone and a few students were beaten, allegedly by the military, and 8 more students have been arrested after police entered the university premises; the students had wanted to go to Ankatso but were blocked in the University by police, which is reported to have raised tensions

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Striking university students from Vontovorona University protested in Ankatso, threw stones, harmed property, set up barricades, allegedly destroyed some exam papers, set fires to brush, and seriously injured a 40-year old man by hitting him with a stone (it seems accidentally). Police clashed with students for over four hours, using tear gas, while some locals threw stones at the demonstrators. The police dismantled the road blocks and returned order without arrests. Commandoes (?) were said to be involved.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Journalists protested against the detention of two jounralists over a libel suit by the government.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Police used tear gas to disperse renewed protests of striking students at Ankatso University; students threw stones in response.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: The official death toll of Operation ""Halt"" is now at 79, including 32 additional deaths since June 20 when 12 Dahalo were killed in clashes in Beliamy forest.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Around 200 protesters made up of striking students marched on Mahajangas city hall armed with knives, sticks and other weapons. They then looted and vandalize merchants nearby. Some merchants attempted to defend their property against the students. They were dispersed by the police but continued to cause destruction with molotov cocktails, destroying at least six cars. At least one person was injured by being burned.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: A Dahalo raid reportedly captured eleven zebu in the Ambroasary-Sud area.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: Two men raided a village in the Ambroasary-Sud area and killed several people.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: The murder of a child led to a riot in which the police station and houes of the gendarmes were burned down after the security services prevented the population from going after the suspect.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Student strikers rallied in front of the Cathedral of Mahajanga, but were dispersed with tear gas. 9 people were arrested, including students, administrative staff of the university and private citizens. One person was injured.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: After around 80 Dahalo raiders seized a herd of zebu. Police set off in pursuit and killed 13 in a firefight lasting several hours.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: A group of Dahalo seized a large herd of zebu and ambushed and shot dead two police officers in the same area as another Dahalo attack.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Some Airmad staff at the Ivato International Airpot engaged in a sit-in. Security forces were there to watch the protest, and reportedly also to stop the leader of the movement from arriving, but this did not happen.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: At least 4 successive attacks and violence have taken place in the Antsalova district, with at least three Dahalo being killed over the course of four armed attacks.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Teachers of Fram Aneffa staged a violent protest involving the burning of tires. They engaged with security services but no injuries or arrests were reported.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: At least 4 successive attacks and violence have taken place in the Antsalova district, with at least three Dahalo being killed over the course of four armed attacks.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Teachers of Fram Aneffa staged a protest but a heavy police presence has dissuaded violence which had characterized earlier protests.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: At least 4 successive attacks and violence have taken place in the Antsalova district, with at least three Dahalo being killed over the course of four armed attacks.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: At least 4 successive attacks and violence have taken place in the Antsalova district, with at least three Dahalo being killed over the course of four armed attacks.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: 20 gunmen with 2 Kalashnikovs and hunting rifles attacked a village. 1 older man was killed.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked the town of Andramy and Beravina. At least 2 Dahalo were reported killed in these attacks. Cattle were also stolen.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Dahalo attacked the town of Andramy and Beravina. At least 2 Dahalo were reported killed in these attacks. Cattle were also stolen.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Looting: About 20 Dahalo with three shotguns raided ""fokontany Soarano"" near Analavory. They stole nine cattle in the attack.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: 18 Dahalo were killed in an attack on one of their bases in the southern region of Madagascar as reprisal against their killing of 2 policemen about a month ago.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: 13 Dahalo were killed on the way back from an expedition where 18 Dahalo were killed in the southern region of Madagascar. It is not clear if this happened on the same day or nearby the previous battle.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: 8 dahalo were killed by villagers during a cattle raid near Esira.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: A villager was killed in an attack by Dahalo on a town near the city of Betroka, where 150 cattle were stolen by about 100 armed men with shotguns.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Members of the Fram Aneffa teachers union who are currently engaged in a strike demonstrated in front of the Ministry of Education. Security forces were present but no fighting was reported.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: A peace marhc was held on the initiative of the Womens Network of Madagascar (RFM).

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: A shootout raged near Esira between 200 dahalo and the gendarmie after the dahalo raided a village in a revege attack. 11 dahalo were killed.

column6: Military Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Movement of forces: 500 civilians and 50 soldiers went into the bush to hunt dahalo which had been preying on people in the region of Northern Tsimo Adrefana. It is not clear how long the offensive would last.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: So far, in the third phase of ""Operation Halt"" to combat insecurity in the south of Madagascar, which is to run between Sept.21 and Oct.2, 124 Dahalo have been killed and 39 captured. Additional fatalities captured in previously coded events.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Agreement: 2,300 dahalo, bringing with them 500 guns, have surrendered to the police and participated in a ritual of forgiveness in the town of Mahaly, and are reported to be planned to be reintegrated into their villages.

column6: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Security forces launched an operation to recover weapons from dahalo in the surrounding area. They clashed with some dahalo leadng to an unspecified number of injuries and weapons captured from the dahalo.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Residents of Belalanda just outside Toliara demonstrated to protest their opposition to the extension of a penal camp near their town.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: After the arrival of ousted President Marcc Ravalomanana back in Madagascar, his supporters took to the streets in Antananarivo. Roads were blocked by the police, but some people were able to get by and erect roadblocks in Ambatovinaky. The demonstrators were dispersed by police using tear gas.

column6: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019) Security and Special Interventions Group
column16: Xinhua; Midi Madagasikara; L'Express de Madagascar
column17: Arrests: Former president Marc Ravalomanana was arrested at his home by members of the GSIS without a warrant or charges being laid. It is believed he has since been moved elsewhere but reports conflict over where. The PM of Madagascar has said that they had to take the former President into custody to protect him due to an alleged plot to assassinate him.

column6: Police Forces of Madagascar (2014-2019)
column17: Security forces clashed with at least 150 dahalo in a border area of Atsimo-Atsinana. Casualties were not specified, but it was reported that a dahalo chief was killed.

column6: Protesters (Madagascar)
column17: Students and young people from the slums of Antananarivo engaged in a counter-protest (to others protesting for the release of the ex-president who had just returned) near Andavamamba to denounce any attept to destabilize the democratically elected regime.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: About 200-300 protesters demonstrated in the capital to demand the release of the former president Ravalomanana. They made a barricade and burned boxes, but were dispersed by the police who used tear gas. Clashes were reported and at least 1 was injured and 3 arrested.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Students from the University of Antananarivo rioted due to load shedding after power was cut to the university. Police intervened to disperse the rioters.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: The driver of a delegation of experts from the Ministry of the Environment and Forests was ""the victim of mob justice"" after hitting three people with his car. Specific injuries were not reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Madagascar)
column17: 2 students were severely beaten by suspected residents of the Befanamy neigbhourhood.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: Students from the Maninday university campus and their neighbours clashed due to rising tensions over insecurity in the neighbourhood, leading to the students putting up a road block and beating up a couple from a surrounding neighbourhood. 80 residents of the surrounding neighbourhoods then invaded campus, armed with knives. Both sides fought using stones and knives; the clashes ended with 1 youth from the Befanamy neighbourhood stabbed to death and 3 students injured before the police intervened.

column6: Dahalo Militia
column17: Agreement: A total of 4000 Dahalo cattle thieves surrendered to police and been disarmed, an increase of 1300 since Oct.6.

column6: Rioters (Madagascar)
column17: A handful of striking employees at the SUCOMA sugar unit barricaded the road to the grounds in protest.
